Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • StringUtils

  • public final class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains various useful methods related to manipulating Strings.

    • Method Detail

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.String[] tokens,
                                    java.lang.String delimiter)
        Combines the given array of strings into a single string, separating neighboring elements by the given delimiter text.
        Parameters:
        tokens - array of tokens to combine
        delimiter - separator to place between neighboring tokens
        Returns:
        "" if tokens is null or has no elements

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.String[] tokens,
                                    java.lang.String delimiter,
                                    int limit)
        Combines the given array of strings into a single string, separating neighboring elements by the given delimiter text.
        Parameters:
        tokens - array of tokens to combine
        delimiter - separator to place between neighboring tokens
        limit - max # of lines to use from the array (rest are truncated)
        Returns:
        "" if tokens is null or has no elements

      • nCopies

        public static java.lang.String nCopies(java.lang.String s,
                                       int n)
        A string that contains s repeated n times.
        Parameters:
        s - string to repeat. if s is null, returns null.
        n - number of repetitions. if 0 or less, returns "".
        Returns:
        null if s == null

      • padL

        public static java.lang.String padL(int n,
                                    int width)
        Pads the number by adding spaces to its left side until it is at least the given width in length.
        Parameters:
        n - number to pad
        width - number of characters wide in which to display it

      • padL

        public static java.lang.String padL(java.lang.String s,
                                    int width)
        Pads the string by adding spaces to its left side until it is at least the given width in length.
        Parameters:
        s - string to pad
        width - number of characters wide in which to display it
        Returns:
        the padded string; guaranted to be the given width if s.length() < width

      • padR

        public static java.lang.String padR(int n,
                                    int width)
        Pads the number by adding spaces to its right side until it is at least the given width in length.
        Parameters:
        n - number to pad
        width - number of characters wide in which to display it
        Returns:
        the padded string; guaranted to be the given width if s.length() < width

      • padR

        public static java.lang.String padR(java.lang.String s,
                                    int width)
        Pads the string by adding spaces to its right side until it is at least the given width in length.
        Parameters:
        s - string to pad
        width - number of characters wide in which to display it
        Returns:
        the padded string; guaranted to be the given width if s.length() < width

      • trimLines

        public static java.lang.String trimLines(java.lang.String s)
        Trims out any leading/trailing whitespace from all lines of string s.
        Parameters:
        s - string to examine
        Returns:
        null if s == null

      • trimEndsOfLines

        public static java.lang.String trimEndsOfLines(java.lang.String s)
        Trims out any trailing whitespace from all lines of string s.
        Parameters:
        s - string to examine
        Returns:
        null if s == null

      • truncate

        public static java.lang.String truncate(java.lang.String s,
                                        int length)
        Trims the given string to be at most the given number of characters in length. Similar to fitToWidth, but doesn't put ... at end.
        Parameters:
        s - string to truncate
        length - number of characters, maximum, to retain from s
